faculties_accepted: SDE - Architecture, Building, and Urban Planning
FoE - Civil Engineering, Material Science, Mechanical Engineering, and Aerospace Engineering
FASS - History, Political Science, and Philosophy
module_restrictions: Master level courses taught in English have higher pre-requisites and Stuttgart would prefer Year 3 NUS students who have achieved high academic grades for their English-taught master courses. The final approval for modules offered to NUS students lies with Stuttgart.
visa_info: EU citizens and citizens from the following countries do not need a visa to enter Germany: Australia, Canada, Honduras, Iceland, Israel, Japan, Korea, Liechtenstein, Monaco, New Zealand, Norway, San Marino, Switzerland, and the United States. All students are advised to apply for the necessary visa immediately after they received the official offer letter/email from their host university. Some visa application process could take up to 2 months to process.
accommodations_info: The Office of International Affairs can arrange housing for exchange students from overseas in student dorms on request. It is the responsibility of the Studierendenwerk Stuttgart/SWS (organisation managing the dormitories) to allocate the dormitory rooms. Students are required to pay the first month rent and deposit (all in all €700) and have to be transferred in advance to Studierendenwerk Stuttgart/SWS (organisation managing the dormitories).

cost_of_living.accommodation: €240 - €400 (First month rent and deposit (all in all 700€) have to be transferred in advance)
cost_of_living.one_time_cost: €110 for student administration for the whole semester

university_description: The University of Stuttgart is a research university located in Stuttgart, Baden-Württemberg, Germany. It was founded in 1829 and has nine faculties. The university is known for its excellence in engineering and natural sciences.
location_description: Stuttgart is the capital and largest city of the German state of Baden-Württemberg. It is located in southern Germany and is home to a diverse population. Stuttgart is known for its industrial prowess, as well as its cultural contributions to the wider German society.
